title: Flight Cancellations Still Running High, but Analysts See Relief Coming
sub_head: Industry watchers voice confidence that airlines are recovering despite the nearly 2,000 scrubbed flights Thursday
body:
The frustrations for travelers continued Thursday as airlines canceled more than 1,000 flights for the 12th straight day, but industry analysts say relief is on the way.
The airline industry has struggled to handle the dual challenge of inclement weather coinciding with an influx of ill crew members infected with Covid-19 as the highly transmissible Omicron variant drives a surge in cases nationwide. But the wave of cancellations is thought likely to ease once infection rates fall and the weather improves, rather than the rough patch becoming a longer-term trend.
